TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SigningCredentials extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the cryptographic key and security algorithms that are used to generate a digital signature.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SigningCredentials> class to specify the signing key, signing key identifier, and security algorithms that are used by WCF to generate the digital signature for a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion>. To set the digital signature details, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.SigningCredentials%2A> property of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion> class.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public SigningCredentials (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey signingKey, string signatureAlgorithm, string digestAlgorithm);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey signingKey, string signatureAlgorithm, string digestAlgorithm) cil managed
Public Sub New (signingKey As SecurityKey, signatureAlgorithm As String, digestAlgorithm As String)
public: SigningCredentials(System::IdentityModel::Tokens::SecurityKey ^ signingKey, System::String ^ signatureAlgorithm, System::String ^ digestAlgorithm);

Docs.param: A that contains the cryptographic key that is used to generate the digital signature.
A URI that represents the cryptographic algorithm that is used to generate the digital signature.
A URI that represents the cryptographic algorithm that is used to compute the digest for the portion of the SOAP message that is to be digitally signed.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms> class to specify the `signatureAlgorithm` and `digestAlgorithm` parameters. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms> class contains a set of static, constant strings that represent cryptographic algorithms. The members that have a `Signature` suffix can be used to specify the `signatureAlgorithm` parameter and the members that have a `Digest` suffix can be used to specify the `digestAlgorithm` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public SigningCredentials (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey signingKey, string signatureAlgorithm, string digestAlgorithm, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier signingKeyIdentifier);

public: SigningCredentials(System::IdentityModel::Tokens::SecurityKey ^ signingKey, System::String ^ signatureAlgorithm, System::String ^ digestAlgorithm, System::IdentityModel::Tokens::SecurityKeyIdentifier ^ signingKeyIdentifier);

Docs.param: A that contains the cryptographic key that is used to generate the digital signature.
A URI that represents the cryptographic algorithm that is used to generate the digital signature.
A URI that represents the cryptographic algorithm that is used to compute the digest for the portion of the SOAP message that is to be digitally signed.
A that specifies the identifier that represents the key that is used to create a digital signature.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms> class to specify the `signatureAlgorithm` and `digestAlgorithm` parameters. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms> class contains a set of static constant strings that represent cryptographic algorithms. The members that have a `Signature` suffix can be used to specify the `signatureAlgorithm` parameter and the members that have a `Digest` suffix can be used to specify the `digestAlgorithm` parameter.

public: property System::String ^ DigestAlgorithm { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the cryptographic algorithm that is used to compute the digest for the portion of the SOAP message that is to be digitally signed.
Docs.value: A URI that represents the cryptographic algorithm that is used to compute the digest for the portion of the SOAP message that is to be digitally signed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SigningCredentials.DigestAlgorithm%2A> property, use one of the constructors that take a `digestAlgorithm` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SignatureAlgorithm As String
public: property System::String ^ SignatureAlgorithm { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the cryptographic algorithm that is used to generate the digital signature.
Docs.value: A URI that represents the cryptographic algorithm that is used to generate the digital signature.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SigningCredentials.SignatureAlgorithm%2A> property, use one of the constructors that take a `signatureAlgorithm` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SigningKey As SecurityKey

Docs.summary: Gets the cryptographic key that is used to generate the digital signature.
Docs.value: A that contains the cryptographic key that is used to generate the digital signature.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SigningCredentials.SigningKey%2A> property, use a constructor that takes a `signingKey` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SigningKeyIdentifier As SecurityKeyIdentifier

Docs.summary: Gets the identifier that represents the key that is used to create a digital signature.
Docs.value: A that specifies the identifier that represents the key that is used to create a digital signature.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SigningCredentials.SigningKeyIdentifier%2A> property, use the constructor that takes a `signingKeyIdentifier` parameter.
